intro: Asyneuma thomsonii var. nuristanica, commonly known as the Nuristan false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan and northern Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers are arranged in a head-like cluster. This variant is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude regions.
